alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll; Madison (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 3:45PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT HENDERSON...SOUTHWESTERN BENTON...SOUTHEASTERN CARROLL...EAST CENTRAL MADISON...NORTHEASTERN CHESTER AND NORTHERN DECATUR COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM CST... At 345 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mifflin, or 7 miles northeast of Henderson, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Lexington, Henderson, Natchez Trace State Park, Natchez Trace State Forest, Parsons, Jacks Creek, Parkers Crossroads, Darden, Mifflin, Wildersville, Dollar, Jeannette, Beech Bluff, Rock Hill, Juno, Holladay, Middle Fork, Timberlake, Hinson Springs, and Cozette. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CST for west Tennessee.
